SELECT LAST_INSERT_ID()
insert into user_account (createTime, createby, deleted, departmentId, duty, email, `name`, `password`, `role`, `state`, username, endTime ) values (#{createtime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{createby,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{deleted,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{departmentid,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{duty,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{role,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{state,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{endtime,jdbcType=DATE} )
mapper.update: update user_account set createTime = #{createtime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, createby = #{createby,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, deleted = #{deleted,jdbcType=INTEGER}, departmentId = #{departmentid,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, duty = #{duty,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, email = #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, `name` = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, `password` = #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, `role` = #{role,jdbcType=INTEGER}, `state` = #{state,jdbcType=INTEGER}, username = #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, endTime = #{endtime,jdbcType=DATE} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select: select id, createTime, createby, deleted, departmentId, duty, email, `name`, `password`, `role`, `state`, username, endTime from user_account where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
